result.execSummary:
The defendant Kenneth M Chapin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Imposed and Stayed.  Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 2 years bifurcated sentence.
Imposed and Stayed.  Conditions, if revoked, are as outlined in probation conditions.
AMENDED 10-10-2016:  General Alcohol Concentration Enhancer removed as defendant's BAC did not qualify for the enhancer.

miscConds.notes: Pay all court costs and supervision fees. DNA surcharge assessed.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment, school, or job training as available and as determined by the agent.

Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent. Defendant may not have any alcohol in or on the premises of home.  Defendant may not go into any establishments that sell alcohol except for restaurants and grocery stores.
Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.
Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent.  Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law.  Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

timeConds.notes: Huber for employment and elder care for Romona Kitzinger.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Adjourned initial appearance on July 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:   Do not drive unless properly licensed.   It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any  alcohol.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.  The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Kenneth M Chapin in court.  Erika Frank Motsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court Reporter Mark Garvin.
